channel.title: Switch to Windows 8.1 or stay with Windows 7
channel.description:
I've been reading a lot about Windows 7 and Windows 8.1 recently.
I've been debating on weather or not to switch over to Windows 8.1 yet. I tried Windows 8 when it first came out and just had a lot of problems with it. I know now that is has been here for awhile it should be better. What do you guys think. Is it worth doing the switch?
The only thing I don't like about Windows 8.1 is the tile. I am going to download the mod to add the start menu back. So that wont be a problem.
Give me a good reason to switch over to Windows 8.1, or give me a good reason not to.
Windows 8.1 is less resource hungry than windows 7, Windows 8.1 also handles file transfers faster, along with supports USB devices better.

item.title: Switch to Windows 8.1 or stay with Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:29, topic:545204”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664086.msg4443010#msg4443010 date=1407505787]
Windows 8 has the most compatibility issues that I’ve ever seen.
[/quote]

compatibility mode

[/quote]
Can’t really confirm how well that works as I don’t have a windows 8 pc, but I know in windows 7 that there are still a good grip of programs that can’t run even in compatibility mode.

Read full topic

item.source: Switch to Windows 8.1 or stay with Windows 7

item.title: Switch to Windows 8.1 or stay with Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

tL:

8.1 is a better operating system 99% of ways. It’s faster, more efficient, it has some nice new features - the only ‘problem’ is the start menu. I mean, I use it exactly as I would Windows 7 (win key + ‘start typing’ + enter) - so it isn’t a real problem for me. But if you use your PC the same way an OAP would, then you’ll probably have some troubles.

Exactly, I downloaded the start menu mod, and it runs exactly the same. I always hear the same complaints about windows 8 over and over, but half of them are not true anymore. I am enjoying Windows 8. I still have Windows 7 installed on a few other computers, but over-all Windows 8 isn’t bad at all.

Read full topic
item.source: Switch to Windows 8.1 or stay with Windows 7

I mean, I use it exactly as I would Windows 7 (win key + ‘start typing’ + enter) - so it isn’t a real problem for me. But if you use your PC the same way an OAP would, then you’ll probably have some troubles.

item.source: Switch to Windows 8.1 or stay with Windows 7

item.title: Switch to Windows 8.1 or stay with Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:19, topic:545204”]I used to use win 8.1 at my work and I use windows 7 at home.

Windows 8.1 was a bit of a pain but it wasn’t that bad (my least favourite windows experience but still much better than ios). If you’re using a touch device I’d imagine win 8 would be a decent option.

I’d say no point in upgrading to windows 8 unless you have a touch screen monitor/have used it and liked it. Windows 9 is coming out semi-soon too.[/quote]
8.2 should come out in August (hopefully the beginning of the month) and it brings a ton of improvements for desktops. Like the start menu, the annoying switch between Metro and Desktop in apps will be lessened when apps can be ran in Desktop mode, and hopefully a few more.

Read full topic
item.source: Switch to Windows 8.1 or stay with Windows 7

item.title: Switch to Windows 8.1 or stay with Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I used to use win 8.1 at my work and I use windows 7 at home.

Windows 8.1 was a bit of a pain but it wasn’t that bad (my least favourite windows experience but still much better than ios). If you’re using a touch device I’d imagine win 8 would be a decent option.

I’d say no point in upgrading to windows 8 unless you have a touch screen monitor/have used it and liked it. Windows 9 is coming out semi-soon too.

Read full topic

item.title: Switch to Windows 8.1 or stay with Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Spades:

Not a fan of the tiles, but I installed a start menu mod, and it runs basically like windows 7. I do need to activate it though. Buying a key off my friend for 20 bucks. The windows is not genuine in windows 8 is a bit extreme. Can’t really do any gaming with that message. Unless someone can show me how to deactivate that. And “activate” it. I did a little research but didn’t go far into it. Figured 20 bucks for a windows 8 key wasn’t bad.

reddit’s software swap can get you one for 5 bucks

Read full topic

item.description:

I switched to 8.1, and so far it’s alright. I didn’t have any of the problems I was having before. Drivers worked fine. Just a few things I am tweaking with. But other than that I am enjoying it.

item.source: Switch to Windows 8.1 or stay with Windows 7

item.title: Switch to Windows 8.1 or stay with Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Even with great difficulty and still not having all of the appropriate drivers, I downgraded my laptop to Win7. It comes preinstalled with win8 and does not provide drivers for win7. I still don’t have all of the appropriate drivers, but I dislike Win8 so much.

Read full topic
item.source: Switch to Windows 8.1 or stay with Windows 7

item.title: Switch to Windows 8.1 or stay with Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:5, topic:545204”][quote author=Spades link=topic=664086.msg4438954#msg4438954 date=1405920835]
had a lot of problems with it.
[/quote]

Such as?

As iconic as the classic start menu is, I don’t see the absolute necessity of it. All my most commonly used applications are either pinned to my task bar or are on my desktop. If there’s a specific application I need, there’s a thing called a search bar - why wouldn’t I search? It’s not 1984…

Window key + X = master race start menu![/quote]
because I auto hide my taskbar and I want to see it easily by pressing the windows key, windows 8 is shit enough it doesn’t allow me to do that
right click in metro apps opens some bizarre shit menu systems instead of doing what a fucking right click option does.
Doing anything is much harder than it used to be because all of the settings are hidden and you have to specifically search for them which is stupid

Read full topic
